column4: wrong.  winex (transgaming) installs a lot of directx support for games and tweaked dlls.
if you are a gamer under linux, use transgaming.  it'll save a lot of time and headaches.
but they DONT install 'directx'  they have their own tweaked version.
from what i have read over the forums insttaling directx itself can cause worse issues.
from what I have ever seen/heard installing anything from microsoft does that, so it's not fair to blame directx ;-)
